title: Article Fetch Data
description: Schema for fetched article data including metadata, content, analysis, and reactions

title.description: Title of the article exactly as it appeared

pub_name.description: The name of the publication or website

coauthor_1.description: Name of the first coauthor. Leave blank if one author

main_author_title.description: Provided title for the main author

main_author_bio_provided.description: Provided biography of the main author (that appeared on the website)

main_author_bio_enriched.description: A short biography for the main author

main_author_ai_summary.description: AI-generated short summary of the journalist or author's background, expertise, and notable work

author_previous_commentary.description: Has the author written about this theme previously? If so, what viewpoints has the author articulated about this subject? Note: Only applicable if author is not the subject of the media monitoring

pub_summary.description: A short one sentence summary of the publication
examples: Widely read international business periodical with an estimated daily circ of 200M, published in print and digital

pub_leaning.description: A short description of the publication's general editorial bias or leaning
examples: Leans center right; associated with Republican Party

full_text.description: The full text of the article with all non-text elements removed. Omit captions

article_word_count.description: The computed word count of the full text

claude_summary.description: A one paragraph summary outlining the main argument of the article

is_coverage.description: Is this third party coverage of the subject of the media monitoring?

is_oped.description: Is this an opinion piece written by the subject of the media monitoring such as an op ed or contributed content?

by_subject.description: Was this article written by the subject of the media monitoring? Derives subject identity from CLAUDE.md context

has_comments.description: Did you see a comments section?

comment_summary.description: A summary of the reaction to the article in the comments section focusing on recurrent reader responses

comments_supportive.description: On a scale of 1 to 10, how supportive would you rank the comments section as being of the author's thesis

comment_count.description: The identified comments count, if available

keywords.description: 5 tags for the article capturing recurring points

display_summary.description: A displayable summary of the coverage following a specific format including publication, date, author, main arguments, comments reaction, and word count
